On March 27 2020, the Timor Leste government announces national state of disaster.

It was originally due to expire on 26 April but starting 28 April, it has been extended to May 27. UPDATE: On April 27 2020, the Timor Leste Government extended the State of Emergency up until May 27 2020. It was originally due to expire on 26 April.

As of 25 June, the state of emergency will NOT be extended a third time but will end on 26 June at midnight local time. Additionally, the Interministerial Commission has decided that the coordination powers of measures to combat COVID-19, will be passed on to the Ministry of Health in coordination with the CIGC and other relevant Ministries. UPDATE: The state of emergency was set to be ended on June 26.
